headline: Anthropic plans an IPO as early as 2026, FT reports
summary: Anthropic, the artificial intelligence startup backed by Alphabet's Google and Amazon.com, has hired the law firm Wilson Sonsini to prepare for an initial ​public offering that could take place as early as 2026, the Financial Times ‌reported on Tuesday.  An IPO would give the company, which operates the AI chatbot Claude, a more efficient way to ‌raise capital and provide leverage for bigger acquisitions through public stock.  The company ⁠has previously turned to Wilson Sonsini ‌for a range of corporate matters.

An IPO would give the company, which operates the AI chatbot Claude, a more efficient way to ‌raise capital and provide leverage for bigger acquisitions through public stock.  The company ⁠has previously turned to Wilson Sonsini ‌for a range of corporate matters.

headline: Salesforce’s Stock Is Historically Cheap as AI Risk Takes a Toll
summary: The maker of customer relationship management software reports earnings after the bell, and has recently pointed to better times ahead, forecasting double-digit revenue growth in the coming years.  “We need a change in sentiment for investors to take a look, and that will be driven by stability and an improvement in topline growth,” said Hilary Frisch, senior research analyst at ClearBridge Investments.  Salesforce’s stock price has been hammered by pessimism all year, plunging 30% in 2025 to make the company the second-worst performer in the Dow Jones Industrial Average and putting it among the 25 worst in the S&P 500 Index.

content.title: Salesforce’s Stock Is Historically Cheap as AI Risk Takes a Toll

Salesforce’s stock price has been hammered by pessimism all year, plunging 30% in 2025 to make the company the second-worst performer in the Dow Jones Industrial Average and putting it among the 25 worst in the S&P 500 Index.

headline: Nvidia’s Fat Margins Are Google and AMD’s Opportunity
summary: The AI revolution has created a unique and high-quality problem for  Nvidia  : The chip maker makes too much money.  Nvidia has fallen under scrutiny over the past month as investors have come to worry about the sustainability of blowout artificial-intelligence spending.  Nvidia’s stock price has picked up some ground this week, but the shares are still down 12% since the company peaked at a $5 trillion market cap in late October.

content.title: Nvidia’s Fat Margins Are Google and AMD’s Opportunity
content.summary: The AI revolution has created a unique and high-quality problem for  Nvidia  : The chip maker makes too much money.  Nvidia has fallen under scrutiny over the past month as investors have come to worry about the sustainability of blowout artificial-intelligence spending.  Nvidia’s stock price has picked up some ground this week, but the shares are still down 12% since the company peaked at a $5 trillion market cap in late October.

headline: The AI Trade Has Powered Wall Street Through Bitcoin’s Wobble. It Sets Up a December Rally.
summary: If  Bitcoin  late autumn slump was meant to drive a stake into the heart of the animal spirits that have powered risky assets higher for much of the past three years, the stock market appears largely unscathed and more than willing to roll the dice into the final weeks of December.  Bitcoin prices, which are inexorably tied to investor sentiment, have rebounded firmly over the past two days, taking the world’s largest cryptocurrency back above $93,000 and stoking risk appetite in markets around the world.

content.title: The AI Trade Has Powered Wall Street Through Bitcoin’s Wobble. It Sets Up a December Rally.
content.summary: If  Bitcoin  late autumn slump was meant to drive a stake into the heart of the animal spirits that have powered risky assets higher for much of the past three years, the stock market appears largely unscathed and more than willing to roll the dice into the final weeks of December.  Bitcoin prices, which are inexorably tied to investor sentiment, have rebounded firmly over the past two days, taking the world’s largest cryptocurrency back above $93,000 and stoking risk appetite in markets around the world.

headline: AI Infrastructure Races Will Be 'Intense' In 2026, Says Google Executive. 'We Must Double Every Six Months.'

headline: Nvidia Stock Drops. What Amazon’s New Chips Mean for the AI Leader.
summary: Nvidia  stock was falling Wednesday, pushed down by the threat of competition from  Amazon.com  new AI hardware.  Nvidia’s competition is Amazon’s new Trainium 3 AI chips, which the e-commerce company launched for customers on Tuesday.  Although Amazon said its chips can reduce the cost of training and operating AI models by up to 50% compared with systems that use equivalent graphics processing units, which are Nvidia’s specialty, the two companies still appear on relatively friendly terms.

content.title: Nvidia Stock Drops. What Amazon’s New Chips Mean for the AI Leader.
content.summary: Nvidia  stock was falling Wednesday, pushed down by the threat of competition from  Amazon.com  new AI hardware.  Nvidia’s competition is Amazon’s new Trainium 3 AI chips, which the e-commerce company launched for customers on Tuesday.  Although Amazon said its chips can reduce the cost of training and operating AI models by up to 50% compared with systems that use equivalent graphics processing units, which are Nvidia’s specialty, the two companies still appear on relatively friendly terms.

headline: Marvell to Buy Celestial AI; Shares Jump on Bullish Remarks
summary: On a post-earnings conference call with analysts on Tuesday, Marvell said it’s more bullish about revenue growth next year and predicted that custom chip sales will increase 20%.  Large customers have renewed orders, and Marvell said there won’t be a repeat of previous “air pockets,” when sales in that unit have declined.  The company also announced plans to acquire startup Celestial AI for at least $3.25 billion, a move it said would bolster the artificial intelligence push.

content.title: Marvell to Buy Celestial AI; Shares Jump on Bullish Remarks
content.summary: On a post-earnings conference call with analysts on Tuesday, Marvell said it’s more bullish about revenue growth next year and predicted that custom chip sales will increase 20%.  Large customers have renewed orders, and Marvell said there won’t be a repeat of previous “air pockets,” when sales in that unit have declined.  The company also announced plans to acquire startup Celestial AI for at least $3.25 billion, a move it said would bolster the artificial intelligence push.

headline: ClimeCo Signs The Climate Pledge, Commits to Achieving Net Zero by 2040
summary: ClimeCo, a global leader in decarbonization, is proud to announce that it has joined The Climate Pledge, a global coalition co-founded by Amazon and Global Optimism with the goal of reaching net-zero carbon by 2040. As part of this commitment, ClimeCo is formally setting a target to achieve net-zero emissions across Scopes 1, 2, and 3 by 2040.

As part of this commitment, ClimeCo is formally setting a target to achieve net-zero emissions across Scopes 1, 2, and 3 by 2040.

headline: United States Washing Machine Market Trends & Forecast Report 2025-2033 Featuring Whirlpool, Samsung, LG, IFB, Panasonic, Haier, Godrej, General Electric, and Electrolux
summary: The United States Washing Machine Market is projected to grow from USD 18.54 billion in 2024 to USD 26.07 billion by 2033, with a CAGR of 3.86% from 2025 to 2033. headline: Artisan Studios Achieves AWS Generative AI Competency
